abstract.p: Aug 1 article about Shimon Peres's defeat in a parliamentary vote for presidency of Israel misstated length of the term; Moshe Katsav, the winner, will serve a single term of seven years; article also overstated legislative experience of Yosef Lapid, who is a first-time member of parliament

block.p: A front-page article on Tuesday about Shimon Peres's defeat in a parliamentary vote for the presidency of Israel misstated the length of the term. Moshe Katsav, the winner, will serve a single term of seven years, not five. The article also overstated the legislative experience of Yosef Lapid, a supporter of Mr. Peres. He is a first-time member of parliament, not a veteran lawmaker.

He is a first-time member of parliament, not a veteran lawmaker.
